description: Today's links AI and the fatfinger economy: Every slip of the finger in money in the bank. Hey look at this: Delights to delectate. Object permanence: 2015, 2020, 2024 Upcoming appearances: Where to find me. Recent appearances: Where I've been. Latest books: You keep readin' em, I'll keep writin' 'em. Upcoming books: Like I said, I'll keep writin' 'em. Colophon: All the rest. AI and the fatfinger economy (permalink) Have you noticed that all the buttons you click most frequently to invoke routine, useful function in your device have been moved, and their former place is now taken up by a curiously butthole-esque icon that summons an unwanted AI? https://velvetshark.com/ai-company-logos-that-look-like-buttholes These traps for the unwary aren't accidental, but neither are they placed there solely because tech companies think that if they can trick you into using their AI, you'll be so impressed that you'll become a regular user. To understand why you find yourself repeatedly fatfingeri
title: Pluralistic: AI and the fatfinger economy (02 May 2025)
